comment.author: 75116182@N04
comment._content: Their outfit look more like "Roaring 20's" but nice photo.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The evening world., February 04, 1915, Final Edition, page 3, lefthand column chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030193/1915-02-04/ed-... Suggests that these were German women and children who were being transported from "the fallen fortress city" at Kiau Chau/Tsing-tao in China back to Germany. They arrived in New York on the Vaterland and one group of them left for Germany on the Italian liner Europa. Their menfolk had been taken prisoner by the Japanese. More on the battle of Tsing-Tao at www.firstworldwar.com/battles/tsingtao.htm and en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Tsingtao
